page.title: 17PAST CHARACTERS
page.content:
His Highness Prince Frederick Duleep Singh lived at Old Buckenham Hall for several years up to 1906. He was nicknamed 'The Black Prince' and is remembered as a generous man who helped restore the Ancient House Museum in Thetford so that it could be opened to the public.
Lionel Robinson was a wealthy Australian businessman who lived at Old Buckenham Hall from 1906 - 1922. His most celebrated achievement was when he arranged for the Australian Touring Team of 1921 to play a representative English XI on the cricket ground he had made at the hall. England declared with 256 runs (Hobbs 85 retired hurt), rain stopped play and the match was declared a draw.
